content: although the first several years of my design career were focused on knitting i actually learned how to crochet long before i learned to knit and crochet has always held a strong position in my crafting heart whenever people ask me which i like more i always say it s like choosing between one s own children it s my firm belief that there are different things that each craft does beautifully and i m happy to see more and more crafters take up both for this sweet little cardigan i knew i wanted it to be mainly crocheted but felt that knitted ribbing at the cuffs hem and front bands would tie it together nicely if you are a crocheter but not a knitter it s possible to approximate the look of ribbing though the fabric will feel a bit bulkier the crocheted stitch pattern is simultaneously open and airy while retaining some body via the cluster stitches with the mesh like pattern it s an easy two-row repeat finished measurements chest circumference at underarm 35 39 25 43 5 47 75 52 56 60 25 64 5 68 75 inches/ 89 99 5 110 5 121 5 132 142 153 164 174 5 cm length 17 18 25 18 75 19 5 19 5 20 20 75 20 75 20 75 inches / 43 46 5 47 5 49 5 49 5 51 52 5 52 5 52 5 cm materials yarn berroco lanas light 100% wool 383 yd/350 m per 3 5 oz/100 g skein color 78106 tea rose 3 3 3 4 4 4 5 5 5 skeins yarn characteristics the sample shown uses a sport-weight 2-ply wool yarn the yarn has a balance between crimpy wool which adds volume with finer micron wool for softness recommended needle size always use a needle size that gives you the gauge listed below - every knitter s gauge is unique 1 us f-5/3 75mm hook 1 us #3/3 25mm circular needle 36-inch/90-cm long 1 set us #3/3 25mm needles for small circumference in the round traditional or flexible dpns 1 long circular or 2 shorter circulars as you prefer notions open-ring crochet markers six 5/8-inch/16mm buttons yarn needle gauge 4 pattern repeats = 4 25 inches/11 cm wide in pattern stitch 12 row 6 vertical repeats = 3 75 inches/9 5 cm long in pattern stitch 24 sts and 40 row = 4 inches / 10 cm in knitted rib note gauge is always measured after blocking
